question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Election Contract Integration] Validation doesn't call Election contract to verify miner's current vote count or candidate status - can delisted candidates continue mining using stale RealTimeMinersInformation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [ProvidedRound Validation] Validation uses BaseRound but doesn't validate ProvidedRound structure - if attacker includes malformed ProvidedRound that causes RecoverFromUpdateValue to corrupt BaseRound, will validation catch it before checking membership? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Round Consistency] Validation doesn't check if BaseRound.RoundNumber matches ProvidedRound.RoundNumber - can attacker submit ProvidedRound from different round that modifies BaseRound inappropriately during recovery? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Blockchain Age] Validation doesn't verify BaseRound.BlockchainAge or round age limits - can attacker exploit expired rounds still in state to bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Extra Blocks Limit] Validation doesn't check BaseRound.ExtraBlockProducerOfPreviousRound or extra block quotas - can miners exceed extra block limits while passing MiningPermissionValidation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Main Chain Height] Validation doesn't verify BaseRound.MainChainMinersRoundNumber for side chains - can side chain miners bypass main chain miner list validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [ConfirmedIrreversibleBlockHeight] Validation doesn't check if miner's ImpliedIrreversibleBlockHeight in BaseRound is reasonable - can attacker claim falsely high LIB to manipulate finality while passing validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [ProducedBlocks Limit] Validation doesn't check BaseRound.RealTimeMinersInformation[pubkey].ProducedBlocks count - can miners exceed per-round production limits while passing MiningPermissionValidation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [InValue/OutValue Consistency] Validation doesn't verify InValue matches PreviousInValue from previous round - can attacker break random number generation chain while passing MiningPermissionValidation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Signature Freshness] Validation doesn't check if Signature in BaseRound (updated by RecoverFromUpdateValue) is fresh or replayed - can attacker reuse old signatures to pass validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [PromisedTinyBlocks] Validation doesn't check PromisedTinyBlocks field - can miners produce more tiny blocks than promised while passing validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [FinalOrderOfNextRound Manipulation] If RecoverFromUpdateValue allows attacker to set FinalOrderOfNextRound=0 for all other miners while keeping their own order valid, can they monopolize next round mining after passing current validation? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Dictionary Iteration Order] If RecoverFromUpdateValue's foreach loop (line 22-30 of Round_Recover.cs) processes keys in non-deterministic order, can attacker exploit ordering to overwrite legitimate miner data with malicious values after passing MiningPermissionValidation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [SupposedOrderOfNextRound Overwrite] RecoverFromUpdateValue overwrites SupposedOrderOfNextRound for ALL miners (line 24-25 of Round_Recover.cs) - if attacker sets all orders to same value in providedRound, will next round fail to start, causing consensus halt after passing validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [RealTimeMinersInformation Reference Type] If BaseRound.RealTimeMinersInformation is a reference type and RecoverFromUpdateValue modifies it in-place, does validation see pre-modification or post-modification state? Can timing of modification bypass checks? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [TryToGetCurrentRoundInformation Failure] If TryToGetCurrentRoundInformation fails at line 19 of AEDPoSContract_Validation.cs but later succeeds in retry, can attacker exploit state inconsistency between fetch and validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [PreviousRound Null Check] If TryToGetPreviousRoundInformation fails at line 57 of AEDPoSContract_Validation.cs and returns empty Round, but MiningPermissionValidation doesn't use PreviousRound, can attacker exploit missing previous round data in other validators? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [LatestPubkeyToTinyBlocksCount Injection] If attacker can manipulate State.LatestPubkeyToTinyBlocksCount before validation (line 58 of AEDPoSContract_Validation.cs), can they bypass ContinuousBlocksValidation while passing MiningPermissionValidation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [ExtraData Tampering] If AElfConsensusHeaderInformation extraData is attacker-controlled and RecoverFromUpdateValue uses extraData.Round, can attacker inject malicious Round data that modifies BaseRound before MiningPermissionValidation checks membership? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/MiningPermissionValidationProvider.cs] [Function: ValidateHeaderInformation()] [Behaviour Enum Validation] If extraData.Behaviour has invalid/undefined enum value, do lines 46-50 of AEDPoSContract_Validation.cs skip recovery, allowing unmodified BaseRound to be used in validation? Can this bypass intended checks? (Medium)
